ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: days since randomization
Numeric Visit Number
Notes: -1.5 = Pre-Screening; -1 = Screening; 0 = Baseline; ## = Visit ## (from 1 to 10); Whole numbers = standard monthly visits; #.001 - #.009 = Unscheduled; #.1 = End of Phase 1; #.2 = End of Phase 2; #.3 = End of Phase 3; #.4 = End of Open Choice Phase; #.5 = End of Study; #.6 = Genetic Analysis; 1000=all visits

ElementDescription: Site
Notes: Study Site

ElementDescription: Do you have a preference for which treatment you receive in this study?
Notes: 1 = Medication only;2 = Combined medication and psychotherapy;3 = No preference ; 999=Skipped

ElementDescription: If given the behavior intervention, my child's behavior will improve.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: The behavior intervention program is probably going to be a lot of work, but it's worth it.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: The behavior intervention program is probably going to be a lot of work, and I doubt that it's worth it.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I feel confident that my family can pull this off (implement the behavior therapy).
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I have some difficulty giving my child rewards for what s/he should be doing.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I think that the behavior intervention may cramp my family's lifestyle.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I feel confident that the school will be able to implement the behavior intervention program.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I feel that the other adult caregivers in my child's life (other than those at school) will handle the behavior intervention program pretty well.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: My first choice for treatment assignment would be behavior therapy without medication.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: If given the medicine, my child's behavior will improve.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I have serious concerns about possible side effects with risperidone or aripiprazole.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: The medicine will allow my child to lead a more normal life.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: Even though I know that risperidone is not "habit forming," I still worry about that.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I am afraid that one of my other children will get the medicine by mistake.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: If the medicine works, I will be willing to use it as long as it helps, even if that is for five years.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I feel guilty about considering a medical solution to my child's problems.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I will be able to give my child the medicine exactly as prescribed.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: Medicine is over-used in today's society.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: It is not important to give medicine exactly as prescribed.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: I cannot recall anyone in my family having a bad reaction to medicine.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: My first choice for treatment would be medication without behavior therapy.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Moderately disagree; 3 = Disagree a little; 4 = Agree a little; 5 = Agree moderately; 6 = Agree a lot

ElementDescription: If your provider were to recommend treatment for depression would you have a preference for:
Notes: 1= I would prefer medication only; 2= I would prefer talk therapy only; 3= I would prefer both medication and talk therapy; 4= I have no preference, any recommendation is fine; 5= I am not interested in any treatment at this time

ElementDescription: If your child's provider were to recommend treatment for depression would you have a preference for your child's treatment?
Notes: 1= I would prefer medication only; 2= I would prefer talk therapy only; 3= I would prefer both medication and talk therapy; 4= I have no preference, any recommendation is fine; 5= I am not interested in any treatment at this time

ElementDescription: Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: Respondent: Other (specify)
Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
